member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.CulDeSacMasks
member.summary: Creates a feature class of polygon masks from a symbolized input line layer.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.CulDeSacMasks.#ctor(System.Object,System.Object,System.Double,System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The input line layer from which the masks will be created. (In, Required)
The feature class that will contain the mask features. (Out, Required)
The reference scale used for calculating the masking geometry when masks are specified in page units. This is typically the reference scale of the map. (In, Required)

The spatial reference of the map in which the masking polygons will be created. This is not the spatial reference that will be assigned to the output feature class. It is the spatial reference of the map in which the masking polygons will be used, since the position of symbology may change when features are projected. (In, Required)

The space in page units surrounding the symbolized input features used to create the mask polygons. Typically, masking polygons are created with a small margin around the symbol to improve visual appearance. Margin values are specified in either page units or map units. Most of the time, you will specify your margin distance value in page units. (In, Required)

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.CreateOverpass
member.summary: Allows intersecting lines to be displayed as overpassing one another by creating bridge parapets and masks to cover the underlying road segment.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.CreateOverpass.#ctor(System.Object,System.Object,System.Object,System.Object,System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The input line feature layer containing stroke representations that intersect—and will be symbolized as passing above—stroke representations in the Input Below Features With Representations parameter. (In, Required)

The input line feature layer containing stroke representations that intersect—and will be symbolized as passing below—stroke representations in the Input Above Features With Representations parameter. These features will be masked by the polygons created in the Output Overpass Feature Class parameter. (In, Required)

Sets the length of the mask polygons along the Input Above Features With Representations parameter by specifying the distance in page units that the mask should extend beyond the width of the stroke symbol of the Input Below Features With Representations parameter. The Margin Along parameter must be specified, and it must be greater than or equal to zero. Choose a page unit (points, millimeters, and so on) for the margin; the default is points. (In, Required)

Sets the width of the mask polygons across the Input Above Features With Representations parameter by specifying the distance in page units that the mask should extend beyond the width of the stroke symbol of the Input Below Features With Representations parameter. The Margin Across parameter must be specified, and it must be greater than or equal to zero. Choose a page unit (points, millimeters, and so on) for the margin; the default is points. (In, Required)
The output feature class that will be created to store polygons to mask the Input Below Features With Representations parameter. (Out, Required)

param.name: out_mask_relationship_class
param.summary: The output relationship class that will be created to store links between overpass mask polygons and the lines of the Input Below Features With Representations parameter. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.CreateOverpass.in_above_features
member.summary: The input line feature layer containing stroke representations that intersect—and will be symbolized as passing above—stroke representations in the Input Below Features With Representations parameter. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.CreateOverpass.in_below_features
member.summary: The input line feature layer containing stroke representations that intersect—and will be symbolized as passing below—stroke representations in the Input Above Features With Representations parameter. These features will be masked by the polygons created in the Output Overpass Feature Class parameter. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.CreateOverpass.margin_along
member.summary: Sets the length of the mask polygons along the Input Above Features With Representations parameter by specifying the distance in page units that the mask should extend beyond the width of the stroke symbol of the Input Below Features With Representations parameter. The Margin Along parameter must be specified, and it must be greater than or equal to zero. Choose a page unit (points, millimeters, and so on) for the margin; the default is points. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.CreateOverpass.margin_across
member.summary: Sets the width of the mask polygons across the Input Above Features With Representations parameter by specifying the distance in page units that the mask should extend beyond the width of the stroke symbol of the Input Below Features With Representations parameter. The Margin Across parameter must be specified, and it must be greater than or equal to zero. Choose a page unit (points, millimeters, and so on) for the margin; the default is points. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.CreateOverpass.out_overpass_feature_class
member.summary: The output feature class that will be created to store polygons to mask the Input Below Features With Representations parameter. (Out, Required)

member.summary: The output relationship class that will be created to store links between overpass mask polygons and the lines of the Input Below Features With Representations parameter. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.CreateOverpass.where_clause
member.summary: An SQL expression used to select a subset of features in the Input Above Features With Representations parameter. (In, Optional)

member.summary: The output line feature class that will be created to store parapet features. (Out, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.CreateOverpass.wing_type
member.summary: Specifies the wing style of the parapet features. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.CreateOverpass.wing_tick_length
member.summary: Sets the length of the parapet wings in page units. The length must be greater than or equal to zero; the default length is 1. member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.DisperseMarkers
member.summary: Finds representation markers that are overlapping or too close to one another, based on symbology and reference scale, and spreads them apart based on a minimum spacing and dispersal pattern.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.DisperseMarkers.#ctor(System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The input point feature layer containing marker representations. (In, Required)

The minimum separation distance between individual markers, in page units. A distance must be specified and must be greater than or equal to zero. When a positive value is specified, markers will be separated by that value; when a value of zero is specified, markers will be touching. The default page unit is Points. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.DisperseMarkers.in_point_features
member.summary: The input point feature layer containing marker representations. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.DisperseMarkers.minimum_spacing
member.summary: The minimum separation distance between individual markers, in page units. A distance must be specified and must be greater than or equal to zero. When a positive value is specified, markers will be separated by that value; when a value of zero is specified, markers will be touching. The default page unit is Points. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.DisperseMarkers.dispersal_pattern
member.summary: Specifies the pattern in which the dispersed representation markers are placed. A group of markers will have a center of mass derived from the locations of all markers in the group. The center of mass is then used as the anchor point around which the dispersal pattern operates. (In, Optional)

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.DetectGraphicConflict
member.summary: Creates polygons where two or more symbolized features graphically conflict.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.DetectGraphicConflict.#ctor(System.Object,System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The input feature layer containing symbolized features. CAD, coverage, or VPF annotation, dimensions, charts, dot-density or proportional symbols, raster layers, network datasets, or 3D symbols are not acceptable inputs. (In, Required)
The feature layer containing symbolized features potentially in conflict with symbolized features in the input layer. (In, Required)
The output feature class to be created to store conflict polygons. It cannot be one of the feature classes associated with the input layers. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.DetectGraphicConflict.in_features
member.summary: The input feature layer containing symbolized features. CAD, coverage, or VPF annotation, dimensions, charts, dot-density or proportional symbols, raster layers, network datasets, or 3D symbols are not acceptable inputs. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.DetectGraphicConflict.conflict_features
member.summary: The feature layer containing symbolized features potentially in conflict with symbolized features in the input layer. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.DetectGraphicConflict.out_feature_class
member.summary: The output feature class to be created to store conflict polygons. It cannot be one of the feature classes associated with the input layers. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.DetectGraphicConflict.conflict_distance
member.summary: Sets the conflict distance. Temporary buffers one-half the size of the conflict distance value are created around symbols in both the input and conflict layers. Conflict polygons will be generated where these buffers overlap. Conflict distance is measured in page units (Points, Inches, Millimeters, Centimeters). If you enter a conflict distance in map units, it will be converted to page units using the reference scale. The default conflict distance is 0, where no buffers are created and only symbols that physically overlap one another are detected as conflicts. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.DetectGraphicConflict.line_connection_allowance
member.summary: The radius of a circle, centered where lines join, within which graphic overlaps won't be detected. This parameter is only considered when the input layer and the conflict layer are identical. Zero allowance will detect a conflict at each line join (if end caps are overlapping). Line connection allowance is calculated in page units (Points, Inches, Millimeters, Centimeters). If you enter a conflict distance in map units, it will be converted to page units using the reference scale. The value cannot be negative; the default value is 1 Point. (In, Optional)

member.summary: The directory of this tool's toolbox.

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.CalculateGridConvergenceAngle
member.summary: Calculates the rotation angle for true north based on the center point of each feature in a feature class and populates this value in a specified field. This field can be used in conjunction with Data Driven Pages to rotate each map to true north.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.CalculateGridConvergenceAngle.#ctor(System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The input feature class (points, multipoints, lines, and polygons). (In, Required)
The existing field that will be populated with the true north calculation value in decimal degrees. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.CalculateGridConvergenceAngle.in_features
member.summary: The input feature class (points, multipoints, lines, and polygons). (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.CalculateGridConvergenceAngle.angle_field
member.summary: The existing field that will be populated with the true north calculation value in decimal degrees. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.CalculateGridConvergenceAngle.rotation_method
member.summary: Specifies the method used to calculate the rotation value. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.CalculateGridConvergenceAngle.coordinate_sys_field
member.summary: The field containing a projection engine string for a projected coordinate system to be used for angle calculation. The angle calculation for each feature will be based on the projected coordinate system projection engine string for the specific feature. In cases of an invalid value, the tool will use the Cartographic coordinate system specified in the Cartography environment settings. The default is none, or no field specified. When no field is specified, the projected coordinate system used for calculation will be taken from the Cartography environment settings. (In, Optional)

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.ThinRoadNetwork
member.summary: Generates a simplified road network that retains connectivity and general character for display at a smaller scale.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.ThinRoadNetwork.#ctor(System.Object,System.Object,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The input linear roads that should be thinned to create a simplified collection for display at smaller scales. (In, Required)

An indication of the shortest road segment that is sensible to display at the output scale. This controls the resolution, or density, of the resulting road collection. If the units are in point, millimeters, centimeters, or inches, the value is considered in page units and the reference scale is taken into account. (In, Required)

The field that stores the results of the tool. Features that participate in the resulting simplified road collection have a value of 0 (zero). Those that are extraneous have a value of 1. A layer definition query can be used to display the resulting road collection. This field must be present and named the same for each input feature class. (In, Required)

The field that contains hierarchical ranking of feature importance, where 1 is very important and larger integers reflect decreasing importance. A value of 0 forces the feature to remain visible in the output collection. This field must be present and named the same for each input feature class. Hierarchy values equal to NULL are not accepted and will raise an error. (In, Required)

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.ResolveBuildingConflicts
member.summary: Resolves symbol conflicts among buildings and with respect to linear barrier features by moving or hiding buildings.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.ResolveBuildingConflicts.#ctor(System.Object,System.String,System.Object,System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The input layers containing building features that may be in conflict, or smaller than allowable size. Buildings can be either points or polygons. Buildings will be modified to resolve conflicts with other buildings and with barrier features. (In, Required)

The field that stores the invisibility values that can be used to remove some buildings from display in order to resolve symbol conflicts. Buildings with a value of 1 should be removed from display; those with a value of zero should remain. Use a definition query on the layer to display visible buildings only. No features are deleted. (In, Required)

The layers containing the linear or polygon features that are conflict barriers for input building features. Buildings will be modified to resolve conflicts between buildings and barriers. Orient value is Boolean, specifying whether buildings should be oriented to the barrier layer. (In, Required)

The minimum allowable distance between symbolized buildings at scale. Buildings that are closer together will be displaced or hidden to enforce this distance. The minimum allowable distance is set relative to the reference scale (that is, 15 meters at 1:50,000 scale). The value is 0 if reference scale is not set. (In, Required)

The minimum allowable size of the shortest side of a rotated best-fit bounding box around the symbolized building feature drawn at the reference scale. Buildings with a bounding box side smaller than this value will be enlarged to meet it. Resizing may happen nonproportionally, resulting in a change to building morphology. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.ResolveBuildingConflicts.in_buildings
member.summary: The input layers containing building features that may be in conflict, or smaller than allowable size. Buildings can be either points or polygons. Buildings will be modified to resolve conflicts with other buildings and with barrier features. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.ResolveBuildingConflicts.invisibility_field
member.summary: The field that stores the invisibility values that can be used to remove some buildings from display in order to resolve symbol conflicts. Buildings with a value of 1 should be removed from display; those with a value of zero should remain. Use a definition query on the layer to display visible buildings only. No features are deleted. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.ResolveBuildingConflicts.in_barriers
member.summary: The layers containing the linear or polygon features that are conflict barriers for input building features. member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.ResolveBuildingConflicts.building_gap
member.summary: The minimum allowable distance between symbolized buildings at scale. Buildings that are closer together will be displaced or hidden to enforce this distance. The minimum allowable distance is set relative to the reference scale (that is, 15 meters at 1:50,000 scale). The value is 0 if reference scale is not set. (In, Required)

member.summary: The minimum allowable size of the shortest side of a rotated best-fit bounding box around the symbolized building feature drawn at the reference scale. member.summary: A one-to-many relationship table that links the aggregated polygons to their source polygon features. member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.SimplifyLine
member.summary: Simplifies lines by removing relatively extraneous vertices while preserving essential shape.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.SimplifyLine.#ctor(System.Object,System.Object,System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The input line features to be simplified. (In, Required)

The simplified output line feature class. It contains all fields present in the input feature class. The output line feature class is topologically correct. The tool does not introduce topology errors, but topological errors in the input data are flagged in the output line feature class. The output feature class includes two additional fields: InLine_FID and SimLnFlag to contain the input feature IDs and the input topological errors, respectively. A SimLnFlag value of 1 indicates an input topological error is present; 0 (zero) indicates that no input error is present. (Out, Required)
Specifies the line simplification algorithm. (In, Required)

The tolerance determines the degree of simplification. You can choose a preferred unit; otherwise, units of the input will be used. MinSimpTol and MaxSimpTol fields are added to the output to store the tolerance that was used when processing occurred. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.SimplifyLine.in_features
member.summary: The input line features to be simplified. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.SimplifyLine.out_feature_class
member.summary: The simplified output line feature class. It contains all fields present in the input feature class. The output line feature class is topologically correct. The tool does not introduce topology errors, but topological errors in the input data are flagged in the output line feature class. The output feature class includes two additional fields: InLine_FID and SimLnFlag to contain the input feature IDs and the input topological errors, respectively. A SimLnFlag value of 1 indicates an input topological error is present; 0 (zero) indicates that no input error is present. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.SmoothLine.tolerance
member.summary: Sets a tolerance used by the PAEK algorithm. A tolerance must be specified, and it must be greater than zero. You can choose a preferred unit; the default is the feature unit. You must enter a 0 as a placeholder when using the BEZIER_INTERPOLATION smoothing algorithm. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.SmoothLine.endpoint_option
member.summary: This is a legacy parameter that is no longer used. It was formerly used to specify whether endpoints of closed lines would be preserved. This parameter is still included in the tool's syntax for compatibility in scripts and models but is hidden from the tool's dialog box. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.SmoothLine.error_option
member.summary: Specifies how topological errors (possibly introduced in the process, such as line crossing or overlapping) are handled. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.SmoothLine.in_barriers
member.summary: Inputs containing features that will act as barriers for smoothing. The resulting smoothed lines will not touch or cross barrier features. For example, when smoothing contour lines, spot height features input as barriers ensure that the smoothed contour lines will not be smooth across these points. The output will not violate the elevation as described by measured spot heights. (In, Optional)

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.GridIndexFeatures
member.summary: Creates a grid of rectangular polygon features that can be used as an index to specify pages for a map book using Data Driven Pages. A grid can be created that only includes polygon features that intersect another feature layer.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.GridIndexFeatures.#ctor(System.Object)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: Resulting feature class of polygon index features. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.GridIndexFeatures.out_feature_class
member.summary: Resulting feature class of polygon index features. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.GridIndexFeatures.in_features
member.summary: Input features can be used to define the extent of the polygon grid that is created. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.GridIndexFeatures.intersect_feature
member.summary: Limits the output grid feature class to only areas that intersect input feature layers or datasets. When input features are specified, the default value is INTERSECTFEATURE. The intersection of input features will be used to create index features. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.GridIndexFeatures.use_page_unit
member.summary: Indicates whether index polygon size input is in page units. The default is NO_USEPAGEUNIT. The tool uses map units by default. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.GridIndexFeatures.scale
member.summary: Scale must be specified if the index polygon height and width are to be calculated in page units. If the tool is being used outside of an active ArcMap session the default scale value is 1. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.GridIndexFeatures.polygon_width
member.summary: Width of the index polygon specifed in either map or page units. If page units are being used the default value is 1 inch. If map units are being used the default is 1 degree. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.GridIndexFeatures.polygon_height
member.summary: Height of the index polygon specifed in either map or page units. If page units are being used the default value is 1 inch. If map units are being used the default is 1 degree. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.GridIndexFeatures.origin_coord
member.summary: Coordinate for the lower left origin of the output grid feature class. If input features are specified the default value is determined by the extent of the union of extents for these features. If there are no input features specified, the default coordinates are 0 and 0. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.GridIndexFeatures.number_rows
member.summary: Number of rows to create in the y direction from the point of origin. The default is 10. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.GridIndexFeatures.number_columns
member.summary: Number of columns to create in the x direction from the point of origin. The default is 10. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.GridIndexFeatures.starting_page_number
member.summary: Each grid index feature is assigned a sequential page number starting with a specified starting page number. The default is 1. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.GridIndexFeatures.label_from_origin
member.summary: Page numbers (labels) starting with the specified starting page number (default is 1) begins with the cell in the lower left corner of the output grid. The default is NO_LABELFROMORIGIN. (In, Optional)

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.StripMapIndexFeatures
member.summary: Creates a series of rectangular polygons, or index features, that follow a single linear feature or a group of linear features. These index features can be used with Data Driven Pages to define pages in a strip map or a set of maps that follow a linear feature. The resulting index features contain attributes that can be used to rotate and orient the map on the page and determine which index features, or pages, are next to the current page (to the left and right or to the top and bottom).

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.StripMapIndexFeatures.#ctor(System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The input polyline features defining the path of the strip map index features. (In, Required)
The output feature class of polygon index features. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.StripMapIndexFeatures.in_features
member.summary: The input polyline features defining the path of the strip map index features. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.StripMapIndexFeatures.out_feature_class
member.summary: The output feature class of polygon index features. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.StripMapIndexFeatures.use_page_unit
member.summary: Indicates whether index feature size input is in page units. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.StripMapIndexFeatures.scale
member.summary: Map scale must be specified if index feature lengths (along the line and perpendicular to the line) are to be calculated in page units. If you're using ArcMap, the default value will be the scale of the active data frame; otherwise, the default will be 1. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.StripMapIndexFeatures.length_along_line
member.summary: The length of the polygon index feature along the input line feature specified in either map or page units. The default value is determined by the spatial reference of the input line feature or features. This value will be 1/100 of the input feature class extent along the x axis. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.StripMapIndexFeatures.length_perpendicular_to_line
member.summary: The length of the polygon index feature perpendicular to the input line feature specified in either map or page units. The default value is determined by the spatial reference of the input line feature or features. This value will be one-half the number used for the length along the line. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.StripMapIndexFeatures.page_orientation
member.summary: Specifies the orientation of the input line features on the layout page. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.StripMapIndexFeatures.overlap_percentage
member.summary: The approximate percentage of geographic overlap between an individual map page and its adjoining pages in the series. The default is 10. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.StripMapIndexFeatures.starting_page_number
member.summary: Each grid index feature is assigned a sequential page number beginning with a specified starting page number. The default is 1. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.StripMapIndexFeatures.direction_type
member.summary: Index features are created in a sequential order and require a starting point. Setting the direction type for the strip map provides a starting point. The default is WE_NS. This means that the starting point for the strip map is either at the western end of the line feature if the line feature's directional trend is West to East/East to West or, if the directional trend is North to South/South to North, the starting point will be the northernmost point of the line feature. The direction type is also applied to secondary line features. (In, Optional)

member.summary: The directory of this tool's toolbox.

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.SimplifyPolygon
member.summary: Simplifies polygon outlines by removing relatively extraneous vertices while preserving essential shape.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.SimplifyPolygon.#ctor(System.Object,System.Object,System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The input polygon features to be simplified. (In, Required)

The simplified output polygon feature class. It contains all fields present in the input feature class. The output polygon feature class is topologically correct. The tool does not introduce topology errors, but topological errors in the input data are flagged in the output polygon feature class. (Out, Required)
Specifies the polygon simplification algorithm. (In, Required)

The tolerance determines the degree of simplification. You can choose a preferred unit; otherwise, the units of the input will be used. MinSimpTol and MaxSimpTol fields are added to the output to store the tolerance that was used when processing occurred. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.SimplifyPolygon.in_features
member.summary: The input polygon features to be simplified. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.SimplifyPolygon.out_feature_class
member.summary: The simplified output polygon feature class. It contains all fields present in the input feature class. The output polygon feature class is topologically correct. The tool does not introduce topology errors, but topological errors in the input data are flagged in the output polygon feature class. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.SimplifyPolygon.algorithm
member.summary: Specifies the polygon simplification algorithm. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.SimplifyPolygon.tolerance
member.summary: The tolerance determines the degree of simplification. You can choose a preferred unit; otherwise, the units of the input will be used. MinSimpTol and MaxSimpTol fields are added to the output to store the tolerance that was used when processing occurred. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.SimplifyPolygon.minimum_area
member.summary: The minimum area for a polygon to be retained. The default value is zero, that is, to keep all polygons. You can choose a preferred unit for the specified value; otherwise, units of the input will be used. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.SimplifyPolygon.error_option
member.summary: This is a legacy parameter that is no longer used. It was formerly used to specify how topological errors possibly introduced during processing were handled. This parameter is still included in the tool's syntax for compatibility in scripts and model but is hidden from the tool's dialog box. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.SimplifyPolygon.collapsed_point_option
member.summary: Specifies whether to create an output point feature class to store the centers of any polygons that are removed because they are smaller than the minimum_area parameter. The point output is derived; it will be named the same as the polygon output feature class you specify in the out_feature_class parameter but with a _Pnt suffix, located in the same folder. (In, Optional)

member.summary: Output Point Feature Class (out, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.SimplifyPolygon.in_barriers
member.summary: The inputs containing features to act as barriers for simplification. Resulting simplified polygons will not touch or cross barrier features. For example, when simplifying forested areas, the resulting simplified forest polygons do not cross road features defined as barriers. (In, Optional)

member.summary: Creates annotation for contour features.

member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.

param.name: in_features
param.summary: The contour line feature class for which the annotation will be created. (In, Required)

param.name: out_geodatabase
param.summary: The workspace where the output feature classes will be saved. The workspace can be an existing geodatabase or an existing feature dataset. (In, Required)

param.name: contour_label_field
param.summary: The field in the input layer attribute table upon which the annotation text will be based. (In, Required)

param.name: reference_scale_value
param.summary: Enter the scale to use as a reference for the annotation. This sets the scale to which all symbol and text sizes in the annotation will be based. (In, Required)

param.name: out_layer
param.summary: The group layer that will contain the contour layer, the annotation, and the mask layer. When working in ArcCatalog, you can use the Save To Layer File tool to write the output group layer to a layer file. When using ArcMap, the tool adds the group layer to the display if this option is checked in the geoprocessing options. The group layer that is created is temporary and will not persist after the session ends unless the document is saved. (Out, Required)

param.name: contour_color
param.summary: The color of the output contour layer and annotation features. (In, Required)

member.summary: The color of the output contour layer and annotation features. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.ContourAnnotation.contour_type_field
member.summary: The field in the input layer attribute table containing a value for the type of contour feature. An annotation class will be created for each type value. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.ContourAnnotation.contour_alignment
member.summary:
The annotation can be aligned to the contour elevations so that the top of the text is always placed uphill. This option allows the annotation to be placed upside down. The contour annotation can also be aligned to the page, ensuring that the text is never placed upside down.
(In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.ContourAnnotation.enable_laddering
member.summary:
Placing annotation in ladders will place the text so it appears to step up and step down the contours in a straight path. These ladders will run from the top of a hill to the bottom, will not cross each other, will belong to a single slope, and will not cross any other slope.
(In, Optional)

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.CreateCartographicPartitions
member.summary: Creates a mesh of polygon features that cover the input feature class where each polygon encloses no more than a specified number of input features or input vertices, determined by the density and distribution of the input features.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.CreateCartographicPartitions.#ctor(System.Object,System.Object,System.Int32)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.

param.name: in_features
param.summary: The input feature classes or layers whose feature distribution and density, or vertex distribution and density, dictate the size and arrangement of output polygons. The input features are typically destined for subsequent processing with contextual generalization or conflict resolution geoprocessing tools. Typically, the input features, when considered simultaneously, would exceed memory limitations of generalization or conflict-resolution geoprocessing tools, so partitions are created to subdivide inputs for processing. (In, Required)

member.param: The output polygon feature class of partitions, each of which encloses a manageable number of input features, or manageable number of input vertices, not exceeding the number specified by the feature_count parameter. (Out, Required)

param.name: feature_count
param.summary:
The ideal number of features or vertices (depending on the partition_method parameter) to be enclosed by each polygon in the output feature class.
The recommended count for features is 50,000, which is the default value. For vertices, 1 million vertices will consume around 0.5 GB of memory depending on the tool using the partitions. The feature count cannot be lower than 500. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.CreateCartographicPartitions.in_features
member.summary: The input feature classes or layers whose feature distribution and density, or vertex distribution and density, dictate the size and arrangement of output polygons. The input features are typically destined for subsequent processing with contextual generalization or conflict resolution geoprocessing tools. Typically, the input features, when considered simultaneously, would exceed memory limitations of generalization or conflict-resolution geoprocessing tools, so partitions are created to subdivide inputs for processing. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.CreateCartographicPartitions.out_features
member.summary: The output polygon feature class of partitions, each of which encloses a manageable number of input features, or manageable number of input vertices, not exceeding the number specified by the feature_count parameter. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.CreateCartographicPartitions.feature_count
member.summary:
The ideal number of features or vertices (depending on the partition_method parameter) to be enclosed by each polygon in the output feature class.
The recommended count for features is 50,000, which is the default value. For vertices, 1 million vertices will consume around 0.5 GB of memory depending on the tool using the partitions. The feature count cannot be lower than 500. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.CreateCartographicPartitions.partition_method
member.summary: Specifies whether the feature_count parameter references the ideal number of features or the ideal number of vertices in each output polygon. (In, Optional)

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.DelineateBuiltUpAreas
member.summary: Creates polygons to represent built-up areas by delineating densely clustered arrangements of buildings on small-scale maps.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.DelineateBuiltUpAreas.#ctor(System.Object,System.Object,System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.

param.name: in_buildings
param.summary: The layers containing buildings whose density and arrangement are used to define appropriate output built-up polygons. Multiple building layers can be assessed simultaneously. Building features can be points or polygons. (In, Required)

param.name: grouping_distance
param.summary: Buildings closer together than the grouping distance are considered collectively as candidates for representation by an output built-up area polygon. This distance is measured from the edges of polygon buildings and the centers of point buildings. (In, Required)

param.name: minimum_detail_size
param.summary: Defines the relative degree of detail in the output built-up area polygons. This roughly translates to the minimum allowable diameter of a hole or cavity in the built-up area polygon. The actual size and shape of holes and cavities within the polygon is determined also by the arrangement of the input buildings, the grouping distance, and the presence of edge features, if they are used. (In, Required)

param.name: out_feature_class
param.summary: The output feature class containing built-up area polygons representing clustered arrangements of input buildings. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.DelineateBuiltUpAreas.in_buildings
member.summary: The layers containing buildings whose density and arrangement are used to define appropriate output built-up polygons. Multiple building layers can be assessed simultaneously. Building features can be points or polygons. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.DelineateBuiltUpAreas.identifier_field
member.summary: A field on the input feature classes that will hold a status code indicating whether the input feature is part of the resulting built-up area . This field must be either short or long integer type and common in all input layers, if multiple input layers are used.0 = The building is not represented by an output built-up area polygon.1 = The building is represented by an output built-up area polygon and is within the resulting polygon.2 = The building is represented by an output built-up area polygon and is outside the resulting polygon. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.DelineateBuiltUpAreas.edge_features
member.summary: The layers that can be used to define the edges of the built-up area polygons. Typically, these are roads, but other common examples are rivers, coastlines, or administrative areas. Built-up area polygons snap to an edge feature if one is generally aligned with the trend of the polygon edge and within the grouping distance away. Edge features can be lines or polygons. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.DelineateBuiltUpAreas.grouping_distance
member.summary: Buildings closer together than the grouping distance are considered collectively as candidates for representation by an output built-up area polygon. This distance is measured from the edges of polygon buildings and the centers of point buildings. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.DelineateBuiltUpAreas.minimum_detail_size
member.summary: Defines the relative degree of detail in the output built-up area polygons. This roughly translates to the minimum allowable diameter of a hole or cavity in the built-up area polygon. The actual size and shape of holes and cavities within the polygon is determined also by the arrangement of the input buildings, the grouping distance, and the presence of edge features, if they are used. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.DelineateBuiltUpAreas.out_feature_class
member.summary: The output feature class containing built-up area polygons representing clustered arrangements of input buildings. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.DelineateBuiltUpAreas.minimum_building_count
member.summary: The minimum number of buildings that must be collectively considered for representation by an output built-up area polygon. The default value is 4. The minimum building count must be greater than or equal to 0. (In, Optional)

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.MakeGridsAndGraticulesLayer
member.summary: Creates a grouped layer of feature classes depicting grid, graticule, and border features using predefined cartographic specifications. Grid layers are ideal for advanced grid definitions that are scale and extent specific.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.MakeGridsAndGraticulesLayer.#ctor(System.Object,System.Object,System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The XML grid definition template stores the specification's graphic properties for each grid layer. In addition to the graphic properties, which cannot be altered before execution, the definition has specific default values, exposed as parameters, that can be modified before execution. (In, Required)
The feature layer or x,y extent used to determine the extent of the grid layer created. (In, Required)

The feature dataset that will store the features. Grid-specific feature classes will be created if they do not already exist. If they already exist, and a grid with the same name and type as the one being created also exists, it will be overwritten. (In, Required)

The grouped layer of feature classes depicting grid, graticule, and border features. Each grid layer can be composed of a mask polygon, a clip polygon, segments (line), gridlines (line), ticks (line), endpoints (point), points (point), and annotation feature classes. (Out, Required)

member.summary: The XML grid definition template stores the specification's graphic properties for each grid layer. In addition to the graphic properties, which cannot be altered before execution, the definition has specific default values, exposed as parameters, that can be modified before execution. member.summary: The name for the cartographic grid created that allows for distinction between grids that are stored in the same feature dataset and set of feature classes, expressed in one of the following formats: (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.MakeGridsAndGraticulesLayer.refscale
member.summary: The scale at which the grid is created and should be viewed. When the reference scale from the XML grid definition file is defined as Use Environment, the reference scale is derived in the following order: (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.MakeGridsAndGraticulesLayer.rotation
member.summary: The rotation angle for the grid components. Rotation is used to provide annotation that is level with the page. Unless otherwise specified, rotation is calculated using the area of interest feature. When the rotation type from the XML grid definition file is defined as Use Environment, the rotation is derived in the following order: (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.MakeGridsAndGraticulesLayer.mask_size
member.summary: The mask is a polygon feature that forms an outer ring around the extent of the neatline and is used to mask data that falls in the area reserved for coordinate labels. Mask size defines the width of the polygon mask feature in map or page units. The data frame may have to be resized to fit around the edge of the mask while including the coordinate labels. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.MakeGridsAndGraticulesLayer.xy_tolerance
member.summary: The minimum tolerated distance between geodatabase features, expressed in linear units. This value is defaulted from the value set in the XML. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.MakeGridsAndGraticulesLayer.primary_coordinate_system
member.summary: The grid template XML file creates grid components depicting coordinates or locations for a primary coordinate system and up to four ancillary coordinate systems. The number of ancillary grids is specified by the file. You cannot add or delete ancillary coordinate systems. All coordinate systems specified must share a common geographic coordinate system. If you want to change the primary coordinate system to one that uses a different datum than the default, say for example, you change the coordinate system from one that uses WGS 1984 to one that uses NAD 1983, you must change each default ancillary coordinate system to NAD 1983 as well. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.MakeGridsAndGraticulesLayer.configure_layout
member.summary: Adjusts the data frame settings to ensure they match the grid layer. The data frame's coordinate system, scale, rotation, size, extent, and clipping can be altered to enforce consistency. This setting is only available when the tool is executed from the ArcMap layout view and is not being run in the background. (In, Optional)

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.MergeDividedRoads
member.summary: Generates single-line road features in place of matched pairs of divided road lanes.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.MergeDividedRoads.#ctor(System.Object,System.Object,System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The input linear road features that contain matched pairs of divided road lanes that should be merged together to a single output line feature. (In, Required)

The field that contains road classification information. Only parallel, proximate roads of equal classification will be merged. A value of 0 (zero) locks a feature to prevent it from participating in merging. (In, Required)

The minimum distance apart, in the specified units, for equal-class, relatively parallel road features to be merged. This distance must be greater than zero. If the units are in points, millimeters, centimeters, or inches, the value is considered as page units and takes into account the reference scale. (In, Required)
The output feature class containing single-line merged road features and all unmerged road features. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.MergeDividedRoads.in_features
member.summary: The input linear road features that contain matched pairs of divided road lanes that should be merged together to a single output line feature. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.MergeDividedRoads.merge_field
member.summary: The field that contains road classification information. Only parallel, proximate roads of equal classification will be merged. A value of 0 (zero) locks a feature to prevent it from participating in merging. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.MergeDividedRoads.merge_distance
member.summary: The minimum distance apart, in the specified units, for equal-class, relatively parallel road features to be merged. This distance must be greater than zero. If the units are in points, millimeters, centimeters, or inches, the value is considered as page units and takes into account the reference scale. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.MergeDividedRoads.out_features
member.summary: The output feature class containing single-line merged road features and all unmerged road features. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.MergeDividedRoads.out_displacement_features
member.summary: The output polygon features containing the degree and direction of road displacement to be used by the Propagate Displacement tool to preserve spatial relationships. (Out, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.MergeDividedRoads.character_field
member.summary: Specify a numeric field that indicate the character of road segments, independent of their road classification. These values help the tool to refine the assessment of candidate feature pairs for merging. Use this parameter in unusual or complex road networks to improve the quality of the output. Where there are null values (or if this parameter is not specified at all), the road character (and merge candidacy) is based only on the shapes and arrangement of features. Use value 999 to lock features from participating in a merge at all. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.CartographyTools.MergeDividedRoads.out_table
member.summary: A many-to-many relationship table that links the merged road features to their source features. This table contains two fields, OUTPUT_FID and INPUT_FID, storing the merged feature IDs and their source feature IDs, respectively. Use this table to derive necessary attributes for the output features from their source features. No table is created when this parameter is left blank. (Out, Optional)
